meanings.definition: The quality or state of being blunt.
meanings.sent1: Her bluntnesses sometimes hurt people's feelings.
meanings.sent2: The bluntnesses of the knife made it difficult to cut through the tough meat.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bluntnesses, he always spoke the truth.
meanings.sent4: The bluntnesses of the rock made it impossible to climb without proper gear.
meanings.sent5: The bluntnesses of his words left a lasting impact on the audience.

meanings.sent1: The bluntnesses of the pencil made it hard to write neatly.
meanings.sent2: His bluntnesses in conversation often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The bluntnesses of the joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The bluntnesses of the scissors made it challenging to cut the fabric smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Her bluntnesses in decision-making sometimes caused delays.

meanings.sent1: His bluntnesses in negotiations often led to quick resolutions.
meanings.sent2: The bluntnesses of her feedback helped him improve his work.
meanings.sent3: Despite her bluntnesses, she was always well-liked by her colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The bluntnesses of his instructions made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: Her bluntnesses in communication made it clear what she expected.
